name: Internship in Sociology, Criminology, Law and Society
description: Through a part-time, unpaid, 200-hour internship, students apply sociological knowledge gained primarily through previous coursework. Students can seek internship opportunities at municipal social service departments or non-profit agencies providing social services, social movement or community-based organizations working for social change, courts or parole offices, for-profit workplaces, or other organizations. Students must confirm internship arrangements well in advance and secure departmental approval for their internship position prior to the start of term. This experiential learning course also includes class meetings, written assignments and oral presentations, as well as an assessment by the internship employer. International students should visit the International Education Centre to ensure they have the appropriate documentation well before the start of the course/internship.
prerequisites: SOC205H5/SOC231H5, SOC221H5 and SOC222H5, completed at least 13.0 credits, minimum CGPA 3.0, P.I.
